control
Class SocketManager

java.lang.Object
  control.SocketManager

public class SocketManager
extends java.lang.Object

This class manages the creation of the communication socket

Author:
Santiago Hors Fraile

Method Summary
 java.net.Socket getSocket()
          This function returns the Socket object that the SocketManager has created.

Constructor Detail

SocketManager

public SocketManager()
Method Detail

getSocket

public static SocketManager getSocket(java.lang.String ipAddress,
                                      int port)
This function creates a new SocketManager to the given ipAddress and port if it was not created already. If it was, it returns the previous Socket.

Parameters:
ipAddress - The string IP address. For example "192.57.311.214".
port - The port. For example: 2441.
Returns:
The SocketManager to handle sending and receiving messages.

sendMessage

public void sendMessage(java.lang.String message)
                 throws java.io.IOException
This function sends a String through the socket.

Parameters:
message - The String message that is going to be sent.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

readMessage

public java.lang.String readMessage()
                             throws java.io.IOException
This function waits until a message arrives to this part of the socket, reads it an returns it as String

Returns:
The message that has been sent by the other part of the socket.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getSocket

public java.net.Socket getSocket()
This function returns the Socket object that the SocketManager has created.

Returns:
The socket.
